result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Anthony Skidmore

records.addlTxt:
3:05 PM Defendant Joseph Anthony Skidmore in court.  Attorney Joseph Michael Pozorski Iii in court for Joseph Anthony Skidmore.  Prosecuting attorney Jacalyn Christie Labre in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel is raising competency. 
The court finds good cause to extend time limits in which the preliminary hearing must be held. 
The court will schedule an outpatient examination and subsequent hearing.

Defendant Joseph Anthony Skidmore in court.  Attorney Joseph Michael Pozorski Iii in court for Joseph Anthony Skidmore.  Prosecuting attorney Jill L. Vendetti in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. 
Preliminary hearing set for 10-19-2022 at 3:00pm
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 194983,
Payable Number: 159229,
Receipt Number: 22R 013482,
Amount: $20.00

Re: Operating a motor vehicle while under the influence - 4th offense on 07-20-22.
Initial appearance set for 10-10-22 at 9:30 am.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-10-22 at 9:30 am in Branch 1.  Bail is set at $5000 recognizance bond with the conditions that the defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle and the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
